arr.title: Introduction
questions: How does introducing sophisticated characters and narratives contribute positively to creative direction and design processes?
What properties of narrative can be harnessed in design, and what is the relationship between narrative and the database?

arr.title: The origin of my interest towards narrative methods
questions: What is my history of interest in visual narrative methods?
What were my doubts towards Harmony Korine being the starting point of this text?

arr.title: “A Crack-Up at the Race Riots” against Lev Manovich’s Database and Narrative
questions: What sparked my fascination with unusual narrative methods, idiosyncrasy, and characterization?
How does Lev Manovich's article 'Database as a Symbolic Form' influence my thinking about idiosyncratic narratives, particularly in relation to 'A Crack-Up at the Race Riots?'

arr.title: The DNA of a Fox
questions: What can be an example of a storyteller's helper method and how does it connect to Manovich's theories about the database and syntagmatic aspects?
How does it serve as both an illustration of the theory presented and a practical tool for creating stories and narratives?

arr.title: “Database Cinema”—Alternative narrative methods in film
questions: How does Manovich's article address the relationship between cinema and the database?
What can be some examples of filmmakers whose methods emphasize the symbiosis of the database and narrative?

arr.title: Manovich on Greenaway and Vertov
questions: What exactly are the methods used by Greenaway and Vertov?

arr.title: “Palindromes” and “Storytelling” as contemporary examples of meaningful experimentation in film
questions: What can be an example of another filmmaker working with unusual, database-like narrative methods?
How does the movie 'Storytelling' use fragmented narrative deliberately to comment on representation in fiction?

arr.title: Korine’s “Jokes” as my illustration of Manovich’s “Database Cinema”
questions: How does Harmony Korine's script for the unproduced movie 'Jokes' illustrate a database-like structure?
How can you translate the feeling of a stand-up performance into a movie script,?
